dt: {bc}a writing acknowledging the receiving of goods or money

dt.t: … he is on the hook right now for some pretty major charges that Mueller has the {wi}receipts{/wi} for …
However, it was just a few weeks earlier that the reality star was crushing on another lovely lady … and we've got the {wi}receipts{/wi} to prove it! HollywoodLife has text messages between the two …

et: Middle English {it}receite{/it}, from Anglo-French, from Medieval Latin {it}recepta{/it}, probably from Latin, neuter plural of {it}receptus{/it}, past participle of {it}recipere{/it} to receive
shortdef: a writing acknowledging the receiving of goods or money
the act or process of receiving

dt: {bc}to give a receipt for or acknowledge the receipt of

shortdef: to give a receipt for or acknowledge the receipt of
